sentences.english: I can put their cursing, you can also get extremely admire.
sentences.chinese: 我可以把自己罵死，也可以把你自責得五體投地。

sentences.english: A strategy for counteracting self-blame is reattribution.
sentences.chinese: 一個應對自責的方法是重新歸因。

sentences.english: Funny and Money blamed themselves for the accident.
sentences.chinese: 方尼和曼妮爲這次事故而自責。

sentences.english: He stood up and bowed to Wang in a show of remorse.
sentences.chinese: 他站起來向王夏虹鞠躬表示自責。

sentences.english: Brian Flynn described himself as having been “ticked off for 22 years.
sentences.chinese: 布萊恩弗林自我描述到，“已經自責了22年”。

sentences.english: In a long, slow degradation of guilt and regret and blame.
sentences.chinese: 在漫長歲月中因內疚，後悔和自責而不斷消逝。

sentences.english: The delusive contents were commonly self-accusation and self-guilty, hypochondriasis.
sentences.chinese: 妄想內容以自責自罪，疑病妄想多見。

sentences.english: The right-hander hasn't allowed an unearned run in his last 41 starts.
sentences.chinese: 因爲，小民已經連續41場先發沒有非自責分了。

sentences.english: Among students of junior middle schools, the state of Self-accusation Tendency of Grade Two is more serious.
sentences.chinese: 在初中生中，初二年級學生的自責傾向比較顯著。

sentences.english: In former times, priests used to abase themselves before the gods.
sentences.chinese: 過去，牧師們常常對神自責。

sentences.english: He disregards your self-satisfied conversation and embraces his self-condemnation.
sentences.chinese: 祂輕看你自滿的禱詞，卻擁抱自責的罪犯。

sentences.english: It is common for those who are oppressed to engage in personalization and self-blame.
sentences.chinese: 那些被壓迫的人很容易陷入個性化和自責之中。

sentences.english: Yi snow tears still keeps cannot stop residing, is full to is self-reproach in words.
sentences.chinese: 伊雪眼淚還是止不住的留，話語裏滿是自責。

sentences.english: Yi snow is really self-reproach, just open a fun.
sentences.chinese: 伊雪真的很自責，只是開個玩笑而已嘛。

sentences.english: 'I blame myself for these two losses, ' Ginobili said.
At the same time, I really regret showing him the ad, I feel self-condemned till now.
sentences.chinese: 我也很後悔給他看那則虛假報道，我到現在都很自責。

definition: guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
